author: WWL Staff
title: Northshore man killed in head-on collision, LSP says | wwltv.com
text: PONCHATOULA, La. — A two-vehicle crash claimed the life of 47-year-old Madisonville native Dustin Thompson on Thursday morning. According to the Louisiana State Police, the incident occurred before 7:30 a.m. on Louisiana Highway 22 near Watters Road when Thompson allegedly lost control of his 2017 Nissan Altima after striking the guardrail and then crossing back over the centerline before colliding with a 2021 Jeep Cherokee traveling in the opposite direction head-on. Despite both drivers being properly restrained, Thompson sustained fatal injuries as a result of the crash and was pronounced dead at the scene, while the driver of the jeep sustained moderate injuries. The driver of the Jeep was transported to a hospital for treatment. As part of the ongoing investigation by Troop L, routine toxicology samples were obtained from both drivers for analysis. ► Get breaking news from your neighborhood delivered directly to you by downloading the new FREE WWL-TV News app now in the [IOS App Store](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/new-orleans-news-from-wwl/id1453203460) or [Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.doapps.android.mln.MLN_d6bcd10196773d6203b7e9b10e53fea3&hl=en_US).

author: Jordan French
title: How The Whitten Team’s Elderly Home Sale Solutions Program Helps Seniors to Settle Stress-Free
text: Navigating the [later](https://gritdaily.com/press-release/waverox-bci-neuroscience-research/) years of life often brings about significant changes, particularly when it comes to where we call home. Selling a house, a place imbued with decades of memories is more than just a financial transaction; it’s a deeply emotional journey. For many seniors, the prospect of managing this process, with all its complexities, can be overwhelmingly stressful. There’s a profound need for services that facilitate the physical aspects of selling a home and provide emotional support and peace of mind. The ideal solution would minimize stress, handle the minutiae of the market, and ensure financial stability without upfront costs. This void is particularly felt by those looking to transition into assisted living or downsize for a more comfortable, manageable lifestyle. Enter Kristi Whitten and her team at Keller Williams Realty, known throughout New Hampshire for their dedicated service. They have crafted the [Elderly Home Sale Solutions](https://elderlyhomesalesolutions.com/) program, a comprehensive initiative specifically designed to support seniors through the home selling process. This program forms an integral part of [The Whitten Team](https://www.facebook.com/kellerwilliams.kristiwhitten.bedfordNH.2015)’s broader commitment to their clients’ peace of mind and financial well-being, setting a new standard in real estate transactions tailored for the aging population. Senior-centric solutions The Whitten Team’s program stands out for its all-encompassing answers to the challenges faced by elderly homeowners. Selling a home can be a significant stressor, especially when it’s tied to the necessity of funding nursing care or transitioning to more manageable living situations. Kristi Whitten and her team facilitate this process by first evaluating the home to identify the most beneficial improvements. These updates have no upfront costs to the sellers, a cornerstone feature of the service that alleviates financial pressure. Once the home sells, the owners benefit from the potentially higher sale price, directly resulting from the improvements made. Tailored transactions Beyond crafting innovative solutions, flexibility and personalization are at the core of The Whitten Team’s strategy. Recognizing that each client’s situation differs, they offer tailored marketing plans, professional staging consultations, and high-quality photography to maximize a property’s appeal. Meanwhile, their commitment to transparent communication ensures that seniors are never in the dark; weekly updates from their agent or team manager keep them informed. At the top, Kristi Whitten values trust and integrity, key aspects that resonate well with her clients from the golden generation who benefit from the Elderly Home Sale Solutions program. Relieving real estate restlessness The logistical aspects of selling a home can be daunting, particularly for those dealing with personal transitions. The Whitten Team addresses this by helping with decluttering and cleaning, coordinating necessary repairs or renovations, and managing the sale process to achieve the best possible outcome within the desired timeframe. This full-service approach ensures a smoother transition for seniors and maximizes returns from their home sales. It’s a dual benefit that supports their financial needs and reduces the emotional and physical stress of such significant life changes. Illuminating an inclusive tomorrow Kristi Whitten’s leadership and the Elderly Home Sale Solutions program embody a commitment to community and client care, setting them apart in a competitive industry. By innovating to create a more sensitive real estate industry, Kristi has built a case to be the best real estate agent in New Hampshire for seniors and their families. Through their program, The Whitten Team provides compassionate service informed by established real estate expertise that honors the specific needs of the aging population. While they continue to serve their community through other initiatives, such as inner-city children’s programs, their professional focus remains on easing the burdens of real estate transactions, allowing older citizens to transition into their next phase of life with peace and dignity. As our society ages, the demand for real estate services that cater specifically to the needs of seniors is becoming increasingly important. The Elderly Home Sale Solutions program exemplifies how thoughtful approaches can significantly ease the transition for those looking to move to more manageable living situations. This trend toward tailored, compassionate real estate practices is not just about better business—it’s about creating a community where every member can navigate life’s changes with dignity and support.

organizations.name: whitten team’s elderly home sale solutions program

author: Maheen Hernandez
title: Avalanche Price Faces Bearish Pressure Amid Bullish Sentiment
text:
Avalanche (AVAX) has been one of the notable performers in the cryptocurrency market, recently reaching new heights and breaking into the top 15 cryptocurrencies. Despite the overall positive market sentiment and growing bullishness surrounding AVAX, the token faces critical challenges that could prevent its price from breaking out further. While the market remains optimistic, bearish pressure is mounting, potentially stalling the rally and causing the price to retrace before continuing upward.
Strong Bullish Momentum Meets Resistance Avalanche has shown a consistent upward trend, particularly after bouncing back from its lows in November. The price has been testing the upper resistance of a rising parallel channel, which has supported its price action over the last few weeks. This is a positive signal, showing that the bulls are active and pushing the price higher. However, there has been a consistent failure to break above the resistance, which has raised concerns that the bullish momentum could be losing steam.
The inability to break through this resistance, combined with an increase in bearish presence, suggests that the market may be at a critical juncture. If AVAX fails to stay above key support levels, it could see a pullback, invalidating the rally. A break below these levels may lead to a significant price drop, confirming the onset of a bearish trend.
Technical Indicators Raise Concerns While AVAX’s price action remains generally bullish in the medium term, there are several bearish indicators that could spell trouble. One of the most concerning signals is the drop in trading volume. After the price hit yearly highs around $37.50, there was a noticeable decrease in trading activity, signaling that traders may have taken profits and are now waiting for a better entry point. This reduced volume often leads to diminished liquidity, which can prevent the price from sustaining its upward movement.
Moreover, the Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) has shown a significant decline in buying pressure. The MACD is a critical tool for gauging momentum, and the recent bearish crossover indicates a weakening of the bullish trend. As a result, this could trigger increased selling activity, pushing the price lower.
Additionally, the On-Balance Volume (OBV) has shown a bearish divergence, which is another sign that the rally may be losing strength. The OBV tracks buying and selling pressure, and the divergence suggests that the bears are gaining more control over the price action. This could lead to a continuation of the downtrend, especially if other indicators align to confirm the bearish momentum.
Death Cross Looms One of the most significant bearish signals for AVAX is the potential formation of a ‘Death Cross’ on the weekly chart. The Death Cross occurs when the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average, signaling a shift from bullish to bearish momentum. The AVAX price had recently undergone a ‘Golden Cross,’ which had brought optimism to the market, but without a significant bullish breakout, the 50-day and 200-day moving averages are now on the verge of crossing, signaling that a pullback could occur.
This pullback could potentially bring AVAX’s price to around $30 before any consolidation or recovery takes place. However, despite the potential for a short-term downturn, the broader market sentiment remains bullish. If AVAX can consolidate and hold above key support levels, it may set the stage for a fresh rally, and the price could push higher again in the coming months.
Conclusion In conclusion, while the bullish sentiment around Avalanche remains strong, the price faces multiple bearish signals that could hinder its immediate progress. The inability to break resistance, coupled with a decline in volume and weakening momentum indicators, suggests that a short-term pullback is possible. However, if AVAX can consolidate above key support levels and the broader cryptocurrency market continues its bullish trend, the token may still see further upside in the future. Investors will need to closely monitor the price action to determine whether the bears can maintain control or if the bulls will manage to push through resistance for a breakout.

author: Megan Bachelder
title: Letter: Maine Legislature vote holds health care hostage
text:
This past week the Maine Legislature voted on a supplemental budget which includes funding for MaineCare. This is an essential lifeline for many of our Lincoln County citizens.
The measure passed but failed to get the required two-thirds vote to take immediate effect. Without this, doctors, hospitals, nursing homes, and clinics across Lincoln County will not be paid in the next few months and will be forced to cut essential services or turn patients away.
Although the vote was on party lines, this should not be a partisan issue. We can do better than this in Maine. Of the House representatives whose districts are in, or partly in, Lincoln County, Abden Simmons, Michael Lemelin, and Katrina Smith voted against the supplemental.
The issue comes up for another vote on Feb. 25. It should not be too much to ask of our representatives that children and working families do not become the victims of a partisan fight in the legislature.
Nigel Calder
Newcastle
